Class Player

java.lang.Object
Move
Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Player
extends Move
implements java.lang.Cloneable
The player class holds all the information about the player and its status in the game. The object also has all the methods for moving the player around the board, as well as going in and out of estate objects

    • isValidEstate

      public void isValidEstate​(Board b, java.lang.String direction)
      Checks which direction the player wants to move and if the estate contains a door and if the the cell hasn't not already been visited this turn If direction is correct and cell unvisited player is removed from the state and redrawn outside the door
      Parameters:
      b - the current board
      direction - the direction the player wants to move

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(Board b, java.lang.String direction)

      Specified by:
      isValid in class Move
      Parameters:
      b - the current board
      direction - the direction the player wants to move
      Returns:
      true or false if this is a vailid move
